case_title: Muhammad Rafique and others vs Nawab Arbab Abdul Zahir Khan and others
respondant: Nawab Arbab Abdul Zahir Khan and others
complaint_summary: Dispute over ownership of shops allegedly constructed on respondents' land versus land leased by petitioners from Municipal Committee, Sibi.
investigation_summary: Respondents claimed the shops were constructed on their land, while petitioners argued they were built on leased land from Municipal Committee, Sibi. Evidence included lease documents and oral testimony.

judgment_summary.appellate_decision: Partly allowed respondents' appeal, remanded case to Trial Court
judgment_summary.issues_to_be_frmed: Whether subject shops are part of the respondents' property
judgment_summary.procedural_error: Appellate Court overlooked rules 25 and 26 of the Code of Civil Procedure 1908
judgment_summary.modification: Trial Judge directed to issue local commission for site inspection and further evidence

Decision_or_verdict: Civil revision petition partly allowed; case remanded to Trial Court for further investigation and findings.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued oral evidence and lease documents were sufficient to prove the shops were not part of respondents' land.
Respondents contended site inspection by a local commission was necessary to resolve the dispute.
assets: 218874 sq.ft. of land described in para 2 of the plaint

property_details.respondents_property: 218874 sq. ft. described in para 2 of plaint
property_details.petitioners_claim: Shops constructed on Municipal Committee, Sibi land leased to their predecessor

witness_statement.PW-1: Admitted respondents have no concern with the subject shops as they were not part of respondents' land.

key_issues: Ownership of shops constructed on disputed land.
Procedural error in remand judgment by Appellate Court.

participants: Representative of Municipal Committee, Sibi with record
local_commission.objective: Determine whether subject shops are part of respondents' property

actions: Deal with local commission report as per law
Allow both sides to lead further evidence if desired
Return evidence/report to Appellate Court with findings within 30 days

legal_terms.Remand: Sending a case back to the lower court for further action.
legal_terms.Local Commission: A court-appointed entity to inspect and report on disputed property.

words_and_phrases.Licensee: A person granted permission to use property without ownership rights.

disclaimer: Judgment may be subject to updates or revisions. Consult official sources for legally binding versions.
summary_vector_notes: The case involves a property dispute over shops allegedly constructed on respondents' land versus land leased by petitioners from Municipal Committee, Sibi. The Appellate Court remanded the case to the Trial Court for site inspection and further evidence. Procedural errors in the remand judgment were identified and corrected.
